document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Palaearctic and Oriental species of the genus Oides Weber, 1801 (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Galerucinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Palaearctic and Oriental species of the genus Oides Weber, 1801 (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Galerucinae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Oides tibiella
Wilcox, 1971 : 17
(new replacement name for
Oides tibialis Laboissière, 1927
);
Kimoto, 1989 : 39
(as synonym of
O. tarsata
, misidentification ).

O. tarsata :
Samoderzhenkov, 1992 : 110
( Vietnam );
Beenen, 2010 : 491
(catalogue). Misidentification

subSubSection.paragraph:
Types .
Lectotype ♂ ( MNHN ), here designated, labeled: “ TONKIN / CHO-GANH / L. DUPORT [p, w] // MUSEUM PARIS [p] / C. FLEUTIAUX [h, w] // Cotype [p, r] // [aedeagus glued on the card]”. Paralectotypes : 1♂ ( MNHN ), same data as holotype ; 1♀ ( MNHN ): “Cho-Ganh / Tonkin / L. Duport [h, w] // ♀ [p, w] // MUSEUM PARIS [p] / V. Laboissière / 1927 [h, w] // COTYPE [p, w, red letters] //
Oides
/
tibialis
m. [h] / V. Laboissière— Dét. [p, w] //
Oides tibiella Wilcox 1972
[h] / A. VACHON—det. [p] / 1.1976 [h, w]”; 1♀ ( IRSB ): “ TONKIN / CHO-GANH / L. DUPORT [p, w] [glued on the following label] // Coll. R. I. Sc. N. B. [p] / Nord / Vietnam [h, y] / /
Oides
/
tibialis
m. / Paratype [h] / V. Laboissière—Dét. [p, w] // Para- / type [p, o] // cf. Ann. Soc. Ent. / France , XCVI , 1927, p. 40. [h, w] //
O. tibialis Laboiss., 1927
/ (non
O. tibialis Duv., 1884
) [h, w] //
Oides tibiella Wilcox
/ 1972 / non tibialis Labois. [h] / A. VACHON det [p] V.1976 [h, w]”.

Variation. Specimens of this species are extremely variable in the forms of the antennae and male aedeagi. Some specimens possess short antennae (length to width ratios of antennomeres I–IX 2.6: 1.8: 2.6: 3.0: 2.6: 2.4: 2.0: 1.6: 1.6: 1.5: 2.0), as in
O. maculata
, but differ in possessing black mesothoracic ventrites, metepisterna, and abdomen.

Diagnosis. This species belongs to the
Oides tarsata
species group. For differences between species see diagnosis of
Oides geiseri
sp. nov.
